title: Strings!
content: Strings are fundamental part of programming languages. As humans we write words/sentences everyday to communicate to each other, every message you input and see in this app is a String.

title: Strings in JavaScript
content: Since Strings are just words or sentences, to create them in code you can wrap any sequence of characters in either a single quote: ' or a double quote: ". Either one works to let JavaScript know that you are creating a String!

answers.explanation: A string is an sequence of characters wrapped in a single or double quote

title: How are numbers Strings?
content: That last question was a bit tricky. Since the number was wrapped with quotes, JavaScript will treat it like a String. You always have to look at the code very carefully, never make any assumptions on what you see but rather how JavaScript will understand it. Anything wrapped in quotes is going to be String.
